alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:28PM EST until January 14 at 6:33AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Monroe, Bibb, Jones and Twiggs Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins on the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge with some areas under 6 feet of water. Backyards of a few homes on the left bank near Glenridge Drive will be flooded. Portions of the Southern Railroad tracks around Mead Road will become inundated. Large portions of agricultural lands just east and south of Macon will be under 1 to 8 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 27.3 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.9 feet on 03/09/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EST.
